Detailed Description

Edge Directed Interpolation (EDI) configuration.

struct Vps_DeiEdiConfig

Field Documentation

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::chroma3DCorThr

Correlation threshold used in 3D processing for chroma. Because the motion values used for chroma 3D processing are based on luma only. Extra protection is needed. Temporal interpolation is only performed for chroma, when there is strong spatial or temporal correlation for the chroma pixel being processed. When the pixel difference is less than this threshold, it is assumed that there exists strong correlation between these two pixels. Thus, increasing this value leads to more chroma pixels being processed in 3D.

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::corScaleFactor

Scaling factor for correlation along detected edge.

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::detCorLowerThr

Lower threshold used for correlation along detected edge

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::inpMode

Interpolation mode. For valid values see Vps_DeiEdiMode.

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::lut[VPS_DEI_EDI_MAX_LUT]

The EDI lookup table maps motion values to the coefficient of temporal filter. Increasing the values leads to favoring 2D interpolated results. Following must hold: 0<=lut0<=lut1<=lut2<=…<=lut15.

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::tempInpChromaEnable

3D processing for chroma.

UInt32 Vps_DeiEdiConfig::tempInpEnable

3D processing (temporal interpolation).
